explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though "Flammble" (ICSC(J), 1995)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: There is a description that the flash point is 153 degC (CLOSED CUP) in HSDB (2006), and it was thought that there was no spontaneous combustibility even if it contacted the normal temperature air. Thus, it was defined as "out of Category".

self_heating_substances.rationale: It was widely used as an industrial materials, and it was considered that there is no self-febrility (dyes, preservative, etc.), and they were carried out the outside of Category.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen and the oxygen is chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 4 based on SPECIES: Rat(female and male); ENDPOINT: LD50; VALUE: 1320mg/kg; REFERENCE SOURCE: SIDS (2006), IUCLID (2000)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was as the outside of Category from LD50 value >10000mg/kg (SIDS, 2006) of the dermal administration test using rats and rabbits.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: It was set as Category 4 based on LC50 value of an inhalation administration test using female male rats, that is 2.2mg/L/4H (2200mg/m3/4H) (SIDS, 2006; IUCLID, 2000).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from description which does not stimulate a rabbit eye (SIDS, 2006;IUCLID, 2000).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: From description which causes serious stimulation to the human eye (ICSC(J), 2005) and the rabbit eye (SIDS, 2006; IUCLID, 2000), it is set as Category 2A.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: From the description that sensitization of the skin is carried out (SIDS, 2006; IUCLID, 2000; ICSC(J), 2005) and sensitization of the guinea pig skin is carried out (SIDS, 2006; IUCLID, 2000), Skin sensitization is considered as Category 1.

carcinogenicity.rationale: There is the negativity by the in vivo mutagenicity test (micronucleus test which uses mouse bone marrow cells) (SIDS, 2006), and it is classified as the out of the Category. In addition, the reverse mutation test (Ames test) using bacteria is also negative (SIDS, 2006; IUCLID, 2000).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There is only a knowledge that the carcinogenesis promoter activity in the female mouse skin was not acknowledged by the limited study(SIDS, 2006;IUCLID, 2000), and data is insufficient. So it cannot be classified.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the statement that there was no effect on reproduction toxicity and malformation in single-generation studies using both male and female rats (SIDS, 2006), it was set as "out of Category".

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (kidney, blood)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was considered as Category 2 (kidney, blood) based on the description of nephropathy, hemolytic anemia (HSDB, 2006) by human exposure, and hematuria (RTECS, 2006) by inhalation of human lowest toxic dose (0.5mg/m3).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney) May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 (kidney) and Category 2 (blood) based on description which affected change of a renal function in humans (SIDS, 2006;ICSC(J), 2005), and blood in humans (ICSC (J), 2005). Although there is a description "an eye may be affected and lens opacities may be occured"(ICSC (J) and (2005)), this was based on old data, and since the affect on an eye was not described (SIDS (2006) of Priority 1 document), it was not included in a classification.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96-hour LC50=2500microg/L of Crustacea (Brown shrimp) (AQUIRE, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (BOD: 68.4% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), and less bio-accumulative (log Kow=2.7 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
